info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 19 at 2:49PM MDT until March 20 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THURSDAY 12 PM TO 9 PM MDT EAST OF THE SANGRE DE CRISTO MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WIND AND LOW HUMIDITY...
...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT THURSDAY 12 PM TO 9 PM MDT ALONG AND EAST OF THE SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY...
.Critical fire weather conditions are anticipated again on Thursday across eastern New Mexico. Gusty southwest winds will return while humidity values fall below 10 percent for several hours in the afternoon. A surface trough in the lee of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains will produce the strongest winds there, with winds a little lighter and humidities a little lower further south. Though high temperatures will be a few degrees below average, high fire danger persists in fine fuels. Winds will decrease Thursday evening, mitigating the critical fire weather concerns.
The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 9 PM MDT Thursday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect.
* AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands and Plains (Zones 123 and 104) from noon until 9 PM MDT on Thursday.
* 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph.
* RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 10 percent.
* IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT THURSDAY
